PlanetWars

public PlanetWars(java.lang.String gameStateString)
Method Detail

numPlanets

public int numPlanets()
Returns the number of planets. Planets are numbered starting with 0.

getPlanet

public Planet getPlanet(int planetID)
Returns the planet with the given planet_id. There are NumPlanets() planets. They are numbered starting at 0.

numFleets

public int numFleets()
Returns the number of fleets.

getFleet

public Fleet getFleet(int fleetID)
Returns the fleet with the given fleet_id. Fleets are numbered starting with 0. There are NumFleets() fleets. fleet_id's are not consistent from one turn to the next.

planets

public java.util.List<Planet> planets()
Returns a list of all the planets.

myPlanets

public java.util.List<Planet> myPlanets()
Return a list of all the planets owned by the current player. By convention, the current player is always player number 1.

getMyPlanets

public Planet[] getMyPlanets()
Return a list of all the planets owned by the current player. By convention, the current player is always player number 1.

neutralPlanets

public java.util.List<Planet> neutralPlanets()
Return a list of all neutral planets.

enemyPlanets

public java.util.List<Planet> enemyPlanets()
Return a list of all the planets owned by rival players. This excludes planets owned by the current player, as well as neutral planets.

notMyPlanets

public java.util.List<Planet> notMyPlanets()
Return a list of all the planets that are not owned by the current player. This includes all enemy planets and neutral planets.

getNotMyPlanets

public Planet[] getNotMyPlanets()
Return a list of all the planets that are not owned by the current player. This includes all enemy planets and neutral planets.

myFleets

public java.util.List<Fleet> myFleets()
Return a list of all the fleets owned by the current player.

distance

public int distance(int sourcePlanet,
                    int destinationPlanet)
Returns the distance between two planets, rounded up to the next highest integer. This is the number of discrete time steps it takes to get between the two planets.

distance

public int distance(Planet source,
                    Planet destination)
Returns the distance between two planets, rounded up to the next highest integer. This is the number of discrete time steps it takes to get between the two planets.

issueOrder

public void issueOrder(int sourcePlanet,
                       int destinationPlanet,
                       int numShips)
Sends an order to the game engine. An order is composed of a source planet number, a destination planet number, and a number of ships. A few things to keep in mind: you can issue many orders per turn if you like. the planets are numbered starting at zero, not one. you must own the source planet. If you break this rule, the game engine kicks your bot out of the game instantly. you can't move more ships than are currently on the source planet. the ships will take a few turns to reach their destination. Travel is not instant. See the Distance() function for more info.

IssueOrder

public void IssueOrder(Planet source,
                       Planet dest,
                       int numShips)
Sends an order to the game engine. An order is composed of a source planet number, a destination planet number, and a number of ships. A few things to keep in mind: you can issue many orders per turn if you like. the planets are numbered starting at zero, not one. you must own the source planet. If you break this rule, the game engine kicks your bot out of the game instantly. you can't move more ships than are currently on the source planet. the ships will take a few turns to reach their destination. Travel is not instant. See the Distance() function for more info.

finishTurn

public void finishTurn()
Sends the game engine a message to let it know that we're done sending orders. This signifies the end of our turn.

isAlive

public boolean isAlive(int playerID)
Returns true if the named player owns at least one planet or fleet. Otherwise, the player is deemed to be dead and false is returned.

winner

public int winner()
If the game is not yet over (ie: at least two players have planets or fleets remaining), returns -1. If the game is over (ie: only one player is left) then that player's number is returned. If there are no remaining players, then the game is a draw and 0 is returned.

numShips

public int numShips(int playerID)
Returns the number of ships that the current player has, either located on planets or in flight.

production

public int production(int playerID)
Returns the production of the given player.
